definition[0]: someone who lives or stays in a particular place
definition[1]: a doctor working at a hospital where he or she is being trained
example[1]: Many retired British people are now resident in Spain.
definition[3]: living or working in a particular place or institution
example[3]: The resident population of mental hospitals has fallen by 20%.
definition[4]: belonging to a particular group of people – used humorously
example[4]: He’s our resident expert on computer games.
definition[5]: someone who lives permanently in a particular place
example[5]: Interest is paid to UK residents without further liability to basic rate tax.
example[6]: Mining companies provided mainly unskilled work for local residents.
definition[6]: someone who is staying in a particular hotel
example[7]: At present the hotel bar is open to residents only.
